channel.title: Comments on: Automatically Loading a Gravatar Image Based on Form Field Input

item.title: By: Mr Matt
item.dc:creator: Mr Matt
item.description: What happened to this? Can you please send me files... of course, for purely academic reason.
item.content:encoded: What happened to this? Can you please send me files… of course, for purely academic reason.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott

item.description:

Any place you see an email form field :-)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to jazzs3quence.

item.title: By: jazzs3quence
item.dc:creator: jazzs3quence
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2012/12/10/automatically-loading-a-gravatar-image-based-on-form-field-input/#comment-3974">Joseph Scott</a>.
Yeah, that was my first thought. Might be cool in a contact form, too.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joseph Scott.

Yeah, that was my first thought. Might be cool in a contact form, too.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2012/12/10/automatically-loading-a-gravatar-image-based-on-form-field-input/#comment-3973">jazzs3quence</a>.
A log in page is one place I've seen it used and is the first place I'd think of.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to jazzs3quence.

A log in page is one place I’ve seen it used and is the first place I’d think of.

item.title: By: jazzs3quence

item.description: Nice! Now I need to figure out something to use this in.
item.content:encoded: Nice! Now I need to figure out something to use this in.
